storyTitle: As Manager, I want to view employee schedules in calendar format to monitor shift coverage

testCases.title: Validate calendar displays employee schedules correctly
preconditions: User is logged in with Manager role credentials
Employee schedules exist in the system for current and next month
At least one employee has assigned shifts
Network connectivity is stable
Browser is supported (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge)

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule calendar page by clicking on 'Schedule Calendar' menu option
steps.expectedResult: Calendar is displayed showing the current month with all employee shifts visible, calendar loads within 3 seconds, current date is highlighted

steps.action: Click on the employee filter dropdown and select a specific employee from the list
steps.expectedResult: Calendar updates immediately to show only the selected employee's shifts, other employees' shifts are hidden, filter selection is reflected in the UI

steps.action: Click on the 'Next Month' navigation button or arrow to move to the next month
steps.expectedResult: Calendar updates to display the next month's view without delay (under 3 seconds), selected employee filter remains applied, all shifts for the selected employee in the next month are displayed correctly

postconditions: Calendar remains on the next month view
Employee filter remains active
User session remains active
No errors are logged in the system

testCases.title: Verify shift types and statuses are highlighted distinctly
preconditions: User is logged in with Manager role credentials
Multiple shift types exist in the system (e.g., Morning, Evening, Night, Overtime)
Multiple shift statuses exist (e.g., Scheduled, Confirmed, Completed, Cancelled)
Calendar page is accessible
Test data includes various shift types and statuses for the current month

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule calendar page and view the calendar displaying multiple employees with different shift types and statuses
steps.expectedResult: Calendar displays with multiple shifts visible, each shift type has a distinct visual indicator (different colors, icons, or patterns), each shift status has a distinct visual indicator, shifts are easily distinguishable from one another, legend or key is displayed showing shift type and status meanings

postconditions: All shift types remain visually distinct
All shift statuses remain clearly identifiable
Calendar view remains functional
No visual rendering issues occur

testCases.title: Ensure unauthorized users cannot access calendar view
preconditions: Test user account exists with non-Manager role (e.g., Employee, Viewer, or Guest role)
Application security and role-based access control is configured
Calendar page URL is known
User is logged out initially

steps.action: Login to the application using non-Manager user credentials (username and password for Employee or other non-Manager role)
steps.expectedResult: User successfully logs in and is redirected to their appropriate dashboard, Manager-specific menu options are not visible

steps.action: Attempt to access the schedule calendar page by clicking on navigation menu or directly entering the calendar page URL
steps.expectedResult: Access to calendar page is denied, user receives an error message indicating insufficient permissions (e.g., '403 Forbidden' or 'Access Denied'), user is redirected to their home page or an error page, calendar data is not displayed

postconditions: User remains logged in with their non-Manager role
No unauthorized access to calendar data occurred
Security event is logged in the system audit trail
User session remains secure

storyTitle: As Manager, I want to generate reports on schedule adherence to analyze workforce compliance

testCases.title: Validate schedule adherence report generation with filters
preconditions: User is logged in with Manager role credentials
Schedule adherence data exists in the system for the selected date range
Employee schedules and attendance records are available
Reporting module is accessible
Network connectivity is stable

steps.action: Navigate to the reporting page by clicking on 'Reports' menu option
steps.expectedResult: Reporting UI is displayed with available report types listed, page loads successfully within 3 seconds, filter options are visible

steps.action: Select 'Schedule Adherence Report' from the report type dropdown and apply filters (date range: last 30 days, department: Sales, employee: All)
steps.expectedResult: Filters are accepted and displayed in the UI, selected values are shown in the filter fields, no validation errors occur, 'Generate Report' button becomes enabled

steps.action: Click on 'Generate Report' button to create the schedule adherence report
steps.expectedResult: Report is generated and displayed on screen within 5 seconds, report contains accurate schedule adherence data for the selected filters, report shows metrics such as adherence percentage, late arrivals, early departures, and absences, data is formatted clearly with headers and proper alignment

postconditions: Report remains displayed on screen
Filter selections remain active
Report data is accurate and matches database records
User session remains active

testCases.title: Verify report export to PDF and Excel
preconditions: User is logged in with Manager role credentials
Schedule adherence report has been generated and is displayed on screen
Browser download settings allow file downloads
Sufficient disk space is available for downloads
PDF and Excel export functionality is enabled

steps.action: Generate a schedule adherence report with specific filters (date range: last 7 days, department: IT)
steps.expectedResult: Report is displayed on screen with complete data, export options (PDF and Excel buttons) are visible and enabled

steps.action: Click on 'Export to PDF' button
steps.expectedResult: PDF file is generated and downloaded to the default download location, file name includes report type and timestamp, PDF opens successfully and displays all report data with proper formatting, headers, footers, and page numbers are present, all tables and charts are rendered correctly

steps.action: Click on 'Export to Excel' button
steps.expectedResult: Excel file is generated and downloaded to the default download location, file name includes report type and timestamp, Excel file opens successfully in spreadsheet application, all report data is present in structured format with proper columns and rows, data is editable and formulas are preserved if applicable, formatting (colors, borders, fonts) is maintained

postconditions: Both PDF and Excel files are saved in download folder
Files are not corrupted and can be opened
Report remains displayed on screen
Export functionality remains available for additional exports

testCases.title: Ensure unauthorized users cannot access reports
preconditions: Test user account exists with non-Manager role (e.g., Employee, Contractor, or Viewer role)
Application security and role-based access control is configured
Reporting page URL is known
User is logged out initially

steps.action: Login to the application using non-Manager user credentials (username and password for Employee or other non-Manager role)
steps.expectedResult: User successfully logs in and is redirected to their appropriate dashboard, reporting menu options are not visible in the navigation menu

steps.action: Attempt to access the reporting page by directly entering the reporting page URL in the browser address bar
steps.expectedResult: Access to reporting page is denied, user receives an error message indicating insufficient permissions (e.g., '403 Forbidden', 'Access Denied', or 'You do not have permission to view this page'), user is redirected to their home page or an error page, no report data or reporting interface is displayed

postconditions: User remains logged in with their non-Manager role
No unauthorized access to reporting functionality occurred
Security event is logged in the system audit trail
User session remains secure and active

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to view employee schedules in list format to quickly find and manage shifts

testCases.title: Validate schedule list displays and filters correctly
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
Employee schedules exist in the system
Database contains schedules with various employees, dates, and shift types
User has network connectivity
Browser is supported (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge)

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule list page by clicking on 'Schedules' menu and selecting 'List View'
steps.expectedResult: Schedule list page loads within 3 seconds and displays all employee schedules in a table format with columns for employee name, date, shift type, and time

steps.action: Verify the initial display of schedules without any filters applied
steps.expectedResult: All schedules are displayed in the list with complete information visible for each schedule entry

steps.action: Click on the 'Employee' filter dropdown and select a specific employee name from the list
steps.expectedResult: Filter dropdown displays all available employees and the selected employee is highlighted

steps.action: Click 'Apply Filter' button after selecting the employee
steps.expectedResult: List updates to show only schedules for the selected employee, other schedules are filtered out

steps.action: Click on the 'Date' filter and select a specific date range using the date picker
steps.expectedResult: Date picker opens, allows selection of start and end dates, and selected dates are displayed in the filter field

steps.action: Apply the date filter along with the existing employee filter
steps.expectedResult: List updates to show only schedules for the selected employee within the specified date range, maintaining both filter criteria

steps.action: Locate the search box at the top of the schedule list and enter a keyword related to shift type or employee name
steps.expectedResult: Search box accepts text input and displays the entered keyword

steps.action: Press Enter or click the search icon to execute the search
steps.expectedResult: Search results are displayed showing only schedules that match the keyword, with matching text highlighted. Results are accurate and relevant to the search term

steps.action: Verify the count of search results displayed matches the number of records shown in the list
steps.expectedResult: Result count indicator shows the correct number of matching schedules (e.g., 'Showing 5 of 100 schedules')

postconditions: Schedule list displays filtered results based on applied criteria
Filters remain active and visible on the page
Search keyword remains in the search box
User remains on the schedule list page
No data is modified in the system

testCases.title: Verify sorting and selection of schedules
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
Schedule list page is accessible
Multiple employee schedules exist in the system with different dates
Schedules are displayed in the list view
No filters are currently applied

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule list page
steps.expectedResult: Schedule list page loads successfully displaying all schedules in default order

steps.action: Locate the 'Date' column header and click on it to sort by date
steps.expectedResult: Column header shows a sort indicator (up or down arrow) and the list is sorted by date in ascending order (earliest to latest)

steps.action: Click on the 'Date' column header again to reverse the sort order
steps.expectedResult: Sort indicator changes direction and the list is now sorted by date in descending order (latest to earliest)

steps.action: Verify the date sorting by checking the first and last entries in the list
steps.expectedResult: Dates are correctly ordered with the most recent date at the top and oldest date at the bottom

steps.action: Click on the 'Employee Name' column header to sort alphabetically
steps.expectedResult: List is re-sorted alphabetically by employee name in ascending order (A to Z)

steps.action: Locate the checkbox in the first row of the schedule list and click to select it
steps.expectedResult: Checkbox is checked and the row is highlighted to indicate selection. Bulk action toolbar appears at the top or bottom of the list

steps.action: Select two additional schedules by clicking their respective checkboxes
steps.expectedResult: All three selected schedules are highlighted with checked checkboxes. Selection counter shows '3 schedules selected'

steps.action: Click the 'Select All' checkbox in the table header
steps.expectedResult: All visible schedules on the current page are selected with checked checkboxes and highlighted rows. Selection counter updates to show total number selected

steps.action: Verify that bulk action buttons (such as 'Delete', 'Export', 'Modify') are enabled
steps.expectedResult: Bulk action buttons are visible and enabled, ready for user interaction

steps.action: Click the 'Select All' checkbox again to deselect all schedules
steps.expectedResult: All checkboxes are unchecked, row highlighting is removed, and bulk action toolbar is hidden or disabled

postconditions: Schedule list is sorted according to the last sort action performed
All schedules are deselected
Bulk action toolbar is hidden or disabled
User remains on the schedule list page
No schedules are modified or deleted

testCases.title: Ensure unauthorized users cannot access schedule list
preconditions: Test user account exists with non-Scheduler role (e.g., Employee, Viewer, or Guest role)
Schedule list page URL is known
User is not currently logged in
Role-based access control is configured in the system
Authorization rules restrict schedule list access to Scheduler role only

steps.action: Navigate to the application login page
steps.expectedResult: Login page is displayed with username and password fields

steps.action: Enter valid credentials for a user with non-Scheduler role (e.g., Employee role) in the username and password fields
steps.expectedResult: Credentials are accepted in the input fields

steps.action: Click the 'Login' button to authenticate
steps.expectedResult: User is successfully authenticated and redirected to the appropriate dashboard for their role

steps.action: Verify the user's role is displayed or indicated in the user profile section
steps.expectedResult: User profile shows the non-Scheduler role (e.g., 'Employee' or 'Viewer')

steps.action: Look for 'Schedules' menu or 'List View' option in the navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: Schedule list menu option is either not visible or is disabled/grayed out in the navigation

steps.action: Attempt to directly access the schedule list page by entering the URL in the browser address bar (e.g., /schedules/list)
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied. System displays an error message such as '403 Forbidden - You do not have permission to access this page' or redirects to an unauthorized access page

steps.action: Verify that no schedule data is displayed or accessible
steps.expectedResult: No schedule information is visible. User remains on the error page or is redirected to their authorized dashboard

steps.action: Check the browser console for any security-related messages or errors
steps.expectedResult: Console shows authorization failure message confirming access was properly restricted

steps.action: Log out and attempt to access the schedule list page without authentication
steps.expectedResult: System redirects to login page with a message indicating authentication is required

postconditions: Non-Scheduler user remains logged in with their original role
No unauthorized access to schedule data occurred
Security logs record the unauthorized access attempt
User is on either the error page or their authorized dashboard
System security integrity is maintained
